meanings.definition: An ancestor from whom a family or group is descended.
meanings.sent1: My great-great-grandfather was the primogenitor of our family.
meanings.sent2: The primogenitor of this dynasty laid the foundation for our traditions.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, we all joked about how the primogenitor's nose shape passed down through generations.
meanings.sent4: The primogenitor's wisdom flowed through the family tree like a mighty river.
meanings.sent5: The portrait of the primogenitor hung proudly in the hallway, watching over us all.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the first of its kind.
meanings.sent1: The Model T car was a primogenitor of modern automobiles.
meanings.sent2: The primogenitor of smartphones revolutionized communication.
meanings.sent3: The primogenitor of this unique dessert was accidentally created in a kitchen mishap.
meanings.sent4: Her groundbreaking research was the primogenitor of a new scientific field.
meanings.sent5: The primogenitor of this innovative design sparked a wave of creativity in the industry.
